data.title: Enclosing Braket didn't work.
data.body:
Hi,
### Description

I can't use the enclosing braket. I tried in varius type of file (i switch the language too, but it still didn't work). I also tried the safe mode: didn't work.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Try to click Ctrl + Alt + Enclosing braket (italian keyboard).
   I also tried Alt Gr + Enclosing braket but still didn't work.
### Versions

Atom 1.8.0, Windows 8.1 64bit.

Thanks in advance for the response.

data.title: Fix overflowing of the tabs II
data.body:
> Note: This PR is in addition to #12059 but for the `1.9` branch.

This is another follow up for #11866. In this case it fixes **split panes**.

data.title: Fix overflowing of the tabs II
data.body: The same as #11930, but this fixes it for **split panes**.

data.title: some suggesstion and bugs
data.body:
ctrl+r, find function and variables,if find,shuld be slide to top this function or variables. if a variables find too much, should be filter or show backend,likes id.
if a variable or a string has selected,the same  variable or string should be highlight,like sublime text.
atom will append a new line in file when save. i think it should be optional.

i had disabled all plugin i had installed, and use the default theme. the html syntax highlight seems wrong.
![qq 20160628115331](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2001704/16403446/c7539c4c-3d27-11e6-8bac-349b23365031.png)
![qq 20160628115402](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2001704/16403447/c753dd10-3d27-11e6-9937-ffb6417ee351.png)
![qq 20160628115504](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2001704/16403448/c7547aa4-3d27-11e6-8d9f-2ed5df38dd00.png)

data.title: Pressing left or right when a menu is open does nothing
data.body:
Open the edit menu

Press left and observe that you are not on the file menu

Press right and observe that you are not on the view menu.

OS:  Ubuntu 64 bit 16.04

data.title: Atom crashes when large files are opened
data.body:
### Description

Atom crashes when large files are opened. I have a JSON file of 10 MB (which is not that large), it opens for the first time, but when I scroll down I get a popup window saying - "The editor has crashed"
### Versions

**Atom**
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

**amp**
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio 2013

data.title: Implement clear for TextEditor in mini mode
data.body:
It would be useful to implement a "clear" function on TextEditor when mini is enabled, that is optional and would allow to easily clear a field with a click as well as provide an event that is fired when the fields value becomes an empty string.

Visually it can look something like this and is only visible when the field has focus: 
![clear_field](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7757/16361433/61a15ed0-3b91-11e6-965b-e044f6cf695f.png)

If this would be an acceptable feature I would start implementing it to introduce it into [atom/settings-view](/atom/settings-view) to clear package searches.

data.title: Maximizing spec window causes the underlying editor to appear
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description
#11960 added the ability to resize the spec window to view the underlying editor.  However, maximizing the window causes the same behavior, which I think is unexpected.  Could a better solution be to add a toggle button for the editor?
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `window:run-package-specs`
2. Maximize the window

**Expected behavior:** Spec window to visually remain the same as the un-maximized version

**Actual behavior:** Editor appears
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.10.0-dev-9705b3d
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

```
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.3.windows.1
visual studio
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: Spec stacktrace cut off
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When running specs through the UI, the stacktraces have the potential to be cut off, like so:
![spec-stacktrace-cut-off](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/16358793/4dfee28e-3aed-11e6-9503-73f08a737efa.png)
In that picture the column number isn't visible.  In more extreme cases the line number or even parts of the filename can be cut off as well.
(the stark white/black contrast also looks really ugly)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Have a sufficiently long directory structure to where the specs are located
2. Purposely create a failing test
3. `window:run-package-specs`

**Expected behavior:** Being able to view the entire stack trace without having to resize the window (maybe by clicking on the stack trace)

**Actual behavior:** Stack trace is cut off at the end
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.10.0-dev-9705b3d
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

```
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.3.windows.1
visual studio
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: Update languages
data.body:
Woo!
- language-css
  - Added pseudo-class support
  - Added inline comments support
  - Added some missing properties
- language-gfm
  - Added `pycon` highlighting
- language-git
  - Added support for `drop` in rebases
- language-json
  - Added `.webmanifest` as a valid file type
- language-less
  - Added `.rc`, `.themerc`, and `.gtkrc` as valid file types
- language-php
  - Added support for the `<=>` operator to fix ligatures
- language-ruby
  - Added support for the `source` keyword
- language-sass
  - Added missing `object-fit` values
  - Added support for new CSS3 colors and deprecated CSS2 system colors
  - Added support for the `picture` element
  - Sass-only: Added support for vendor-prefixed properties
  - Better highlighting for `@mix` and `@namespace`
  - Added support for `@supports` feature queries
  - Fixed `@include` tokenization
- language-sql
  - Removed MySQL comments which also fixed temporary tables being tokenized as comments
  - Added support for `nvarchar`
  - Added `.dsql` as a valid file type

data.title: Atom consistently complains about missing package.json
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Whenever I'm using dev mode and working on a file in some general directory, Atom complains bitterly every time I save something because there's not a `package.json` file. Most of the things I'm working on are text files or personal bits of code that are never going to see a package manager or somebody else's computer and have no need for version or dependency information. While I appreciate Atom's ability to access and utilize the package information, I don't think it's appropriate that it assumes that I need a `package.json` file in every single directory. The dev tools console should only pop up when there's an _actual_ error.
### Versions

```
Windows 10
Atom 1.8.0
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

data.title: Invisible characters break ruby code
data.body:
### Description

I love Atom interface and functionality, but sometimes it creates an invisible character that breaks my code. Allow me to explain. When I write this, in my tests (for example):

``` ruby
subject(:square) { Square.new } 

# ... rest of my test
```

When running the test, I get this error: 

```
syntax error, unexpected tIDENTIFIER, expecting '}' (SyntaxError)
  subject(:square) { Square.new(7) }
                                    ^
```

What I do in this cases is to **delete and rewrite the line** without using autocomplete. Sometimes it works. If that does not solve the problem, I directly rewrite the line in **vim**.

However, that **does** happens with this specific character -> **}**.

Any ideas?
### Versions

OS X 10.11.5
Atom 1.8.0
ruby 2.3.1

data.title: Atom crashes when trying to load a file
data.body:
When I try open my webpack generated bundle.js file using Atom, it crashes every time.

I'm using the latest version of Atom with Ubuntu 16.04 and have tried running in safe mode, re-installing atom and tried opening the file with using another PC and it still crashed. The only time it doesn't crash is when I minify the file which is only 411.7 kB when un-minified.
#### Output from the terminal when the crash happens

/usr/bin/atom: line 98: 10962 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) nohup "$ATOM_PATH" --executed-from="$(pwd)" --pid=$$ "$@" > "$ATOM_HOME/nohup.out" 2>&1
App load time: 580ms
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id:
#### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04

data.title: Adding install instructions for binary packages
data.body:
Hi,

In this pull request I am adding install instructions for Atom binary packages built using `script/grunt mkdeb` / `script/grunt mkrpm`. 

Thanks or your time,
Brenton

data.title: Renaming Linux sections; adding SUSE section
data.body:
Hi,

In this pull request I added a SUSE section, I also improved the accuracy of the Linux section titles (as these instructions should work on derivative distributions too), specifically:
- Debian Linux (Ubuntu) → Debian / Ubuntu / Linux Mint / derivatives thereof
- Red Hat Linux (Fedora) → CentOS / Fedora / Red Hat Enterprise Linux / derivatives thereof

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Use in-path 7z on AppVeyor, tidy-up publish
Duplicated file goes to wrong path
data.body:
### Description

Bad path when I paste a file under a path which contains a number.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Assume I have a file located under `/users/myuser/blablabla/v1.0/some/path/file.txt`
2. Duplciate the file onto the same folder by copying/pasting.

**Expected behavior:**
The duplicated file should put right next to the original file, i.e. `/users/myuser/blablabla/v1.0/some/path/file0.txt`

**Actual behavior:**
The duplicated file goes to `/users/myuser/blablabla/v10.0/some/path/file.txt`
### Versions

Atom : `1.8.0`
Electron : `0.36.8`
Chrome : `47.0.2526.110`
Node : `5.1.1`

apm : `1.9.2`
npm : `2.13.3`
node : `0.10.40`
python : `2.7.11`
git : `2.7.4`

OS version: `OS X El Capitan 10.11.5`

data.title: Stop running crash reporter on UI thread on Windows/Linux
data.body:
This is not necessarily or desirable on Windows or Linux (but is required by Crashpad on the Mac).

It adds to the spurious output noise on the command line aalthough is not the only cause (removing verbose messages for crash_service and also not starting crash reporter if we're just going to quit anyway is a good idea)
